intro: Potentilla verna var. porrigens, commonly known as the spring cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features wiry, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters during early spring, usually between March and May. Its leaves are palmately divided into five oval lobes, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas.
